m_szDocTitle: Low Cost Hydrogen Fuel Cell Catalyst Discovered By Rutgers Researchers
m_szDocSumamry: July 27th, 2013 by Tina Casey   Viewed up close, tungsten sulfide looks like a bunch of sea urchins moshing at a foam party, but this chemical compound could become the next workhorse of the hydrogen fuel cell field. A team of researchers from Rutgers University is on track to develop nanoscale sheets of tungsten sulfide as a low cost replacement for platinum catalysts in fuel cells, and that could help push the electric vehicle market out of reliance on expensive lithium-ion batteries and into a more affordable format.
